website_summaries.verdict: Other iced tea makers cost much more to deliver the same product. The quick cooling option makes this a good option for frequent iced tea drinkers.
pros: By far one of the most affordable iced tea makers on the market today
Features a "flash cooling" option that reduces the need for ice
Tea is brewed more naturally, in a self-contained unit
cons: We had some concerns about total capacity, but the manufacturer claims to deliver two quarts
Availability is also variable, so it pays to buy it soon or get on a wishlist

customer_reviews.title: I really love this! I have mostly cold brewed my tea ...
customer_reviews.text: I really love this! I have mostly cold brewed my tea because it's so convenient. It says 6 to 12 hours so I set it up, tuck it in the fridge overnight and it's ready for me the next day. Super easy! I find this tastes better and is easier than any of the electric ice tea makers I've owned and with the cold brew method it's like when I used to make sun tea only more convenient. Instead of waiting through the day for the sun tea to brew I can have it brewing overnight while I sleep. I would highly recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Whitty

customer_reviews.title: 100% recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and instructions are clear. I have used this over 10x in the past week, seems very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Tanguay

customer_reviews.title: Does The Trick!
customer_reviews.text: Just in time for Summer, I had a real yen for iced teas of all kinds this year, seeing as I'm off the sauce and no longer needed to store enormous pitchers of Long Island Iced Teas and chilled gin in my fridge. (Just kidding). Seriously, this thing works like a charm and the best thing about it for me (besides the tea) is that it fits so well in the refrigerator, being a tall, slimline container. Perfect. It will be much used and appreciated as the summer progresses.
customer_reviews.author: JordanJasper

customer_reviews.title: I’m enjoying homemade ice tea.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy drinking ice tea year round and now it’s easy to make at home. I’ve been using this ice tea maker/pitcher for a couple of months. It is easy to use and to clean. I keep the pitcher in my fridge all the time and make a new pitcher of tea about every other day. I usually make the tea by using hot water with fresh tea bags and place directly on the door shelf of the fridge. It’s ready to pour over ice in a few hours. My teenage son is now a fan of ice tea because with the pitcher in the fridge, it’s easy and tastes great.
customer_reviews.author: Chappy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Guayusa is very stubborn about rinsing out.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's just the type of loose tea, but guayusa is very stubborn about rinsing out! I like that the pitcher is USA made and it's not bulky like my old pitchers (that ended up outside as plant water pitchers). You do need to be mindful of how much you twist it open to pour, otherwise you will get spills. Pitcher rates a 4, infuser rates a -3 for guayusa tea. Sorry Takeya, your product would be much better if there was an easier way to clean the infuser.
customer_reviews.author: My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Tea stains the pitcher but who cares
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life?! So easy to use! I make iced green tea daily now that i have this. It requires less tea than recommended in the directions, in my opinion, I use 4 tea bags and let it steep longer and it turns out perfect. I was concerned about pouring hot water into plastic but it’s been fine. I would like to see a glass option however. The pitcher (and tea basket) does stain over time but I rarely washed mine, as it’s always in use.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Rice

customer_reviews.title: Amazing iced tea maker!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely am in love with this tea maker! I got so I could make my own cold press green tea. I love cold green tea and spend too much money buying it. I did a lot of research and read a lot of reviews before deciding on this pitcher. I love that it is made of a nice think material and also enjoy the handle. It’s not like a thick plastic. It feels more luxurious than that. I also like that if I am for any reason needing iced tea and don’t have time to steep it overnight,l, that there is the option to add hot water and ice.
customer_reviews.author: Lalunajf

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is soo easy to use for those every day tea drinkers! You can deviate from the instruction a lot and still make some good tasting iced tea. Experiment. It's hard to go wrong. Makes a lot to last several days. Replaced our fat glass tea maker that took a lot of space in the fridge. This one fits in the door. The tall mesh strainer is sometimes hard to clean - takes a lot of rinsing to get rid of tea leaves stuck at the bottom. After about a year of use, still looks brand new. It's a little pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Best pitcher I've found
customer_reviews.text: Great for tea on the road. Pros: Actually air tight Can safely throw it in a back seat and still have dry seats later Doesn't stain brown from frequent tea brewing Holds temperature pretty well Cons: Little small, but cheap enough to buy 2 Hard to judge the water displacement of the cap, i try and and fill it all the way and end up spilling a small amount when i screw the top on
customer_reviews.author: Copper

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful if you want burnt. Not leakproof or air proof.
customer_reviews.text: I just use this product to brew a jug of hot tea then let it sit out until it chills so i can have my cold unsweetened tea. In theory this is a good product until you go to make tea in it. I put my tea in the strainer like advised and then put hot water in and sealed the jug up. The tea started floating so i turned the unit upside down and it pretty much exploded hot water out of the top and all over my hand burning my hand. Everything was shut tight. What happened to leak proof and air proof lid. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh- just a pitcher
customer_reviews.text: This is simply a leak proof pitcher. The chill technology is the ice you add. Not exactly cutting edge technology. $20 for a good picher that doesn't leak is reasonable but let's not pretend this has some kind of cooling technology built into it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Price

customer_reviews.title: No box, doesn't fit in huge fridge
customer_reviews.text: I read the questions section before buying and people asked if it came in a box. Two folks responded that it did. Mine came in a plastic bag. That is fine, but not very nice for gifting. Also, the 2 quart is very, very tall. Make sure it will work for you before buying the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar H.

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLE. Godsend for the summer!
customer_reviews.text: Do not hesitate to buy this product. It's an amazing product that performs exactly as described. It's incredibly well designed and almost everything comes apart for easy cleaning. The tea maker itself is high quality. The parts feel luxurious & durable. Everything fit properly and reflects that there is good quality control within the company. Also a plus, it's mostly made in the US. The tea filter & silicone portions are made in China. Since receiving it 2 days ago, I've made many iced teas with loose leaves. The instructions are easy to follow and the flash chill technology works flawlessly. It's truly worth it if you have the proper tea to go along with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wong

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Your heading on the first page of this product states clearly in bold print, MADE IN THE USA. I received the pitcher and the package says, DESIGNED IN GERMANY, AND MADE IN CHINA. Please change your page so the consumer can find made in the usa products honestly. Or action will be taken. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: jeanne m dominick

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works well as advertised, but I decided I prefer coldbrew given enough time. Th only thing I would recommend changing, is the threading on the filter that connects to the extension tube. I'm guessing it is due to the threads on the filter part only being less than an inch in length on either side, but it is difficult to get it to get the collar to thread onto it correctly. Bit annoying.... Also... The silicon handle Seems like it would be unnecessary if the handle had just been designed a bit thicker. I feel like the silicone handle is just going to slip off at some point.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Makes wonderful tea
customer_reviews.text: This is super great and easy and fast. I had a Mr Coffee iced tea pot, the brew basket was dropped and the tab broke off. The brew basket is not available for purchase. The second one i bought has a different brew basket without the tab. The ones with the tab allow the tea to steep. I love this one by Takeya. I can steep as long as i want, cold brew or flash chill. It's easy to clean. Beware because some of the pieces aren't dishwasher safe. It's too tall for my fridge but laying it down works fine. No leaking. I bought the Harney and sons tea sachets and the tea is wonderfully fresh tasting.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mary Quite Contrary

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Good quality,sturdy,,tall but can fit in the refrigerator door. Easy to use,but not as easy to remove loose tea leaves after which isn't a deal breaker. Can use fruit as well to infuse into the tea along with your tea leaves/tea bags. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D'Silva

customer_reviews.title: An outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best engineered kitchen gadgets ever purchased. I have two, and use them strictly for iced tea. I prefer cold brewing the tea, so I have not tested this product with hot water. However, cold brewing tea is a snap. The tea filter fits snugly. Loose tea leaves do not leak into the tea. The product is leak proof. My grandson really tested this with vigorous shaking with the product upside down. Not a drop leaked. This is an excellent product, well made, well designed, and durable. It is an excellent investment.
customer_reviews.author: drbobstl

customer_reviews.title: Full Instructions are NEEDED
customer_reviews.text: I really thought that this would be perfect for both cold brew coffee and Thai tea. But it's not. 1. There are threads at the top of the filter that don't fit in anywhere. But I can just stand the filter up. 2. It is really, really hard to clean the filter!!! The coffee grounds or tea leaves pack down into the filter and are very difficult to get out without letting it sit for two days, drying. On the plus side, the pitcher itself is a nice shape, kind of oblong rather than actually round, and fits will alongside other items in the beverage section.
customer_reviews.author: vn dd

customer_reviews.title: Best iced tea maker yet
customer_reviews.text: I drink quite a bit of iced tea and so I use this almost every day. I have had it about 8 months now and it’s holding up very well. I like the sealed, leak proof lid, it keeps the tea fresh and allows you to travel easily with the pitcher. It is a simple system to use and because there is no heating unit it is more flexible and portable than other makers I have owned. I have used it at home, in motels, camping and in the RV. I use mine with loose tea from The Republic of Tea and the flavors are delicious. It is also easy to infuse fruits.
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Refreshing ice tea; Easy to use pitcher
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use pitcher. Easy to clean as well. I have tried both cold & hot brews. Pitcher holds up very well to extreme temperatures. It was great placing loose tea into it before bedtime and having a fully brewed, cold pitcher of fresh ice tea in the morning. This will be terrific during the hot summer months. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: annalisa

customer_reviews.title: Great for coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used this for tea (I’ve had it for about 1 1/2 months so far) but I have for coffee!! Pour grounds into the holder and fill with cold water. Let sit for 24 hours. BOOM. Cold brew coffee. Easier than pie! The design & use is quite nice and convenient. I also love the ‘drip container’ it comes with that prevents you from dripping all over the counter!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but I’m happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had it for a few days yet, so I can’t write about durability yet. However, it does feel fairly sturdy. One person commented on leaky spout...I have not had any issues. I pour my tea into a glass on my desk at work with no worry it will spill on papers or my keyboard. The little cup to put the mesh steeper in after use is a nice touch. One comment is that a measuring line at the 2 cup mark would’ve been helpful. Eyeballing it has been fine, but maybe something that could be added in a future model? Overall, I’m happy with it. It means I get to drink fresh ice tea at work!
customer_reviews.author: John & Denise

customer_reviews.title: Cold brew ice tea is great!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this if you are looking into making ice tea. This pitcher works great for making cold brew tea. I recommend only using this to cold brew your tea, I personally think that brewing hot tea and then chilling it tastes terrible. Cold brew tea is very smooth and it is not bitter at all. I only wish the pitcher was made from glass instead of plastic since I am trying to move away from having any plastic interacting with my food.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Tea Pitcher
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews unless an item is exceptionally good or exceptionally bad. This tea pitcher is exceptionally good! I love iced tea but hate dealing with hot, dripping tea bags and don't have room in my refrigerator for a large pitcher. This item solves all the problems. The infuser easily holds two family-size tea bags. I can remove them from the hot water without ever a mess, and the pitcher stores easily in my refrigerator door. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: E. J. Keel

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy iced tea- ingenious design.
customer_reviews.text: Takes only a minute to set up a pitcher of iced tea. Works best and best flavor if you use cold water, let it sit overnight at room temperature then shake it and refrigerate it. Ingenious design and easy to clean. Can be used w either loose tea or tea bags. No more buying iced tea by the bottle- this is easier, less expensive and better for the planet
customer_reviews.author: JaeMae

customer_reviews.title: I bought a 1 qt pitcher that I liked so I got a couple more of the Takeya ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 1 qt pitcher that I liked so I got a couple more of the Takeya 2 qt models. The best part is the airtight feature. This product is quite tall, taller even than my 4 qt Rubbermaid pitcher I got these to replace. I bought 1 regular pitcher and 1 with the tea infuser insert which is interchangeable with either. (-1) Star minor issue but both of the 2 qt pitchers I got had a slight misshapen/crushed look to them. The tops were round and no issues with the lid sealing but the bottoms were slightly oval.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Iced Tea in No Time
customer_reviews.text: This iced tea maker is a wonderful concept. It brews hot tea using a strainer, so one can use loose or bagged tea. You make the tea very strong, then, you add ice cubes and shake the tea maker. You now have freshly brewed ice tea ready-to-serve. The brewer is well designed, sturdily made, and works just as it should. This is also a good gift choice.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Should have just bought the coffee one again
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this nearly as much as the coffee one and wish I had just bought another one of those and saved some money. It's an increadably awkward height and difficult to fit anywhere in my fridge. I also don't like that it has a lot more parts that seem so unnecessary and a pain to deal with. There's one part that's included that I have no idea what it's for and is shown in absolutely none of the diagram pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny

customer_reviews.title: it works but coffee will stain it for sure.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for coffee. coffee sits in the jug for 2 days usually before we can drink it off. Mine discolored after a few times. Even though i wash and clean it each time in between, there is no way to prevent discoloration. However, it does not affect function. I have 5 of these for tea, juice , coffee and water for the last 2 years. I ordered this one to replace the stained but I ended up returning cause they send me a jug with plastic wrapped around it only. There is no box and I ordered it new instead of from the amazon warehouse
customer_reviews.author: Lovelearn

customer_reviews.title: Takeya is LEAK PROOF QUALITY!
customer_reviews.text: I have given over a dozen of these with nice loose green tea and a set of mugs as my standard gift for weddings, and new graduates and housewarming gifts. EVERYONE raves over how perfect these are. Make tea or whatever and you can lay these on their SIDE in the fridge or cooler and they work, never ever leak. Wash in the dishwasher, and are wonderfully light weight yet rugged.
customer_reviews.author: N. Basile

customer_reviews.title: Do the cold brew, its great
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars, its great. im not here to tell you why its great, just that if you buy it, make sure you cold brew the tea and not flash brew, the tea tastes soooooo much better if you cold brew it (Cold brew takes about 12 hours , so overnight basically, flash brew uses hot water and takes like 15 minutes. but the taste isnt as good.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love their products!
customer_reviews.text: Everything that I have bought has been quality from this brand. The pitchers fit so nicely into the door of the fridge, I can put them in the dishwasher, and it seals so well! We sometimes make big pitchers of margaritas and then just close the lid and shake! Put a pitcher in the back of a car when we made sun tea and no leaks on a bumpy trip. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Lazypuppergaming

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Make sure insert is twisted to lid tight
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally bought the iced tea version i stead of the cold brew coffee version, but seems same to me. Just looked up cold brew coffee instructions online. Really loving this and I’m saving about 70% from my normal Starbucks daily iced coffee run. Really great. Only tip is to make sure insert where you put coffee grounds is secured tight to the lid. Once it came off and grounds got in my coffee as I was pouring. Overall love this product. Able to make better tasting iced coffee at home for a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to store my tea in my tiny refrigerator. This fits in the door nicely. I don't really use the basket for the tea, but I do add the steeped tea and ice and shake it as recommended in the directions. It does not leak. I also like that you can completely close the lid because we all know that tea can absorb refrigerator smells. That does not happen with this container. I'm going to try making some infused tea or water soon.
customer_reviews.author: Selena

customer_reviews.title: Great product, one pot process
customer_reviews.text: I bought a one quart one at Marshall’s in 2009. Loved it but it was too small. Found the two quart one here and bought that one in 2013. LOVE IT! I’ve made loose leaf teas for years, needed a pot to brew, then store the iced tea. Now I just use one container and it is great. I drink a quart a day, and take it to work with me. Someone mentioned about it hissing when brewing the tea. Do not close it tightly then, because the air will expand and need to escape. It is leak proof. The handle on mine just broke today, so I’m ordering a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Paula R. Bertrand

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite kitchen tools!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my second Takeya as my husband and I go through tea so quickly. My first pitcher has held up for years and I love combining loose leaf teas both hot and cold. The strainer is tricky to clean and will stain after awhile, but I use a bottle scrubber and water bottle tablets to give it a deep clean when needed. If you buy the sleeve you can flash chill your tea whoch is pretty cool. The colors are nice and do not fade (I have a green and blue one).
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Wampus

customer_reviews.title: Sounded better than it is
customer_reviews.text: It is very big. It's a decent tea maker I just wish it wasn't so bulky. I liked the fact that it is dishwasher safe, but its too big for our dishwasher (we have a normal size dishwasher). I did NOT like the twist on filter to the cap. It is not lined up well and 8/10 times it comes undone-very frusterating. The "leak proof" part was not true. The first time I used it I got tea all over the floor, and I had the opening aligned with the spout.
customer_reviews.author: Kmic

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I got the 1-qt version since I'm the only one who drinks iced tea in my house. I love it! Quick and easy iced tea! I use the large "family sized" tea bags (just one at a time) instead of loose tea, so it's easy-peasy to clean the tea out. I've had it for nearly a month and it's doing great. My only regret is that I didn't get the 2-qt version because I can easily drink 1 quart per day. So my hubby told me to get another one and rotate them. And I think I'm going to do that... maybe in another color! =)
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Missing the infuser holder - but works well
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and it worked great and as advertised. The instructions indicated to “let hot water cool to suggested temperature” before pouring over the tea. BUT there is No instructions about temperatures- very weird. AND- the parts list indicates an “infuser holder” but it was NOT included.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Throckmorton

customer_reviews.title: Is it tablespoon or teaspoon?
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product enough to buy a second one. I did have to replace the infuser on my first one because it got a spot of mold (I probably didn’t dry it as well as I thought). The amount of loose leaf tea to add somehow quadrupled between my 2016 version and my 2018 version going from 8tsp to 8 tablespoons. Which is the correct amount? I’ve been fine with 8tsp but depending on the tea have occasionally added more. I know they sell these in a lot of tea shops, did they just change from tsp to tablespoon to sell more tea or is one of these incorrect? Inquiring minds need to know.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Brew tea and store in same container!
customer_reviews.text: This pitcher looks like glass but you can brew and add ice in the same pitcher. I also like the top that you can unscrew half way to pour and it stays put and holds the ice back and doesn't fall out. I got the avocado color and its a really nice color. I especially like that it is made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Deb F

customer_reviews.title: Great for fresh brewed tea
customer_reviews.text: Wish I found this earlier. I brew my own tea and had made a contraption to brew a large amount at once. This brews so well. The container takes up much less room than my larger tupperware ones, too. As my teas are all different colors, I get the added bonus of seeing that brightness through the container, too.
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Really love this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this iced tea maker and I use it daily. I've always loved iced tea and having some on hand in the fridge, but rarely made it because of having to clean several things (container, strainer, etc.) after the tea was made and it just became a hassle. This is my new favorite kitchen staple and has made it so simple to have iced tea whenever I want!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my loose leaf teas. It also is the perfect shape to fit in my refrigerator. I make up a fresh patch in the morning and enjoy drinking throughout the day. It’s a good way for me to stay hydrated. I don’t enjoy just drinking water. I’m a recovering soda drinker (coke)!!!😆
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Great iced tea maker and portable too
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves iced tea but we've tried all sorts of iced tea makers and the devices simply wear out. This is a very good design and all you need are tea bags and hot water. We actually travel with them since it's quite easy to get hot water in any country we travel to. Ice might be another story but we generally can find some. This will fit in most refrigerator doors and even small hotel refrigerators. If you love iced tea and want to make it yourself - this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: PAKMAN

customer_reviews.title: All fine!  I have two for slow brew.
customer_reviews.text: I primarily use it to slow brew green tea. It's been great for that! I have two and just keep swapping them kn ty he refrigerator. I use organic green tea bags from Sam's Club. I've made hot tea quickly into cold tea a few times, as this plastic kettle is meant to due. It was alright, although I just think that slow brew provides a smoother taste.
customer_reviews.author: ChicogGuy

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Convenient for Coffee & Tea Lovers
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of the 2 quart size. One for cold brew coffee and the other for cold brew tea. Easy and convenient to use and clean. The filter - where you put the coffee grounds, tea leaves or tea bags is a fine mesh and you will not find any sediment in the bottom of the pitcher. I previously had a glass container from another company and I was always afraid of breaking it while cleaning it and always had sediment from the coffe grindsThis pitcher fits nicely inside the refrigerator door. If you drink a lot of cold brew coffee or tea I would personally recommend purchasing the 2 quart size - you won’t regret it
customer_reviews.author: grandma of 4

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for MY Needs
customer_reviews.text: Now I see what all the hype was about. I was on the fence when I purchased the tea maker. It just took making tea in it one time and I was sold. I bought the 1 quart size and it is a perfect size. I love that you can make a full pitcher and if you don't drink it all in a day, you can keep it fresh with the air-tight lid in the refrigerator. I also love the flash chill feature. And if you compare it to the pricey tea/coffee makers, you really get your money's worth out of this tea maker. It is a super product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Raine

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The small pitcher is thick plastic so it isnt going to melt with hot water. Doesn't take up a lot of space so its very easy to store. I love the fact that filter connects to the top lid so it's easy to take in and out. The only thing I wish is that the bottom of the filter was mesh so it would be easier to clean as is it's still not that bad to clean
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Go
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make my hot coffee and hot tea. I didn’t think the container could hold the heat but it did! This is easy to use, clean, and pour. With other drink containers, whenever I’m pouring, it leaks and makes a mess. With this, everything is always clean and simple
customer_reviews.author: hintri

customer_reviews.title: Not my first order
customer_reviews.text: I started using this product over 5 years ago. I love the flavor of my tea and the ease of use. I would have rated 5 stars, but after a few uses, it does get cloudy and stained. And eventually, it will leak. But, overall I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan G Boveda

customer_reviews.title: Best hands on method
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a tea maker that was a little simpler, more hands off, but the power button keeps breaking every year or so. (I make tea every day so I use it more than normal.) This puts you back to boiling the water which means it is not just set up and forget it like the other one. And if you follow their instructions, you can have iced tea right away. I prefer volume so I add more water than can be chilled right away. I usually achieve cool but not cold. Overall I like it and I like that there does not appear to be anything to break.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen C

customer_reviews.title: Great Easy ice tea maker
customer_reviews.text: I got the 2 quart iced tea maker, which I'm glad I did it's perfect size for 2 of us. What a great pitcher. You make your tea right in it, add ice and store! I dont store it on its side, so leakage is not an issue( as some people mentioned), although I've not noticed any leaking. It's narrow and fits in any space I have in refrigerator. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it advertises
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy for this, it replaced an different brand that over time had developed a crack. I cannot speak yet to the durability of this item but so far it is working great and I use it to make tea a couple of times a week.
customer_reviews.author: gatorinco

customer_reviews.title: Better than my last one.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I wanted. It is less messy and has a better design than the similar one I used to have from Teavana. It comes with a cup to put the infuser in so the liquid doesn’t drip when you clean out the infuser.
customer_reviews.author: Tchasse

customer_reviews.title: Way better than traditional iced tea makers
customer_reviews.text: This iced tea maker is very easy to use. The container, lid and inside parts are all high quality. Love that I can steep tea for as long as I want. Love that it fits in my fridge door. Love the green lid color and how it seals so well. Love how quickly I can have ice cold tea! This product is amazing and I’m so glad I bought this instead of a Mr. Coffee Iced Tea maker.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Martin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Love this iced tea maker!!! I like that you can flash brew or leave in overnight. Either way it’s great tea. The company has a website to order spare parts including the o ring gaskets if you need them. I’m buying the fruit infuser for it too
customer_reviews.author: brenda Wright

customer_reviews.title: Handy gadget makes great tea that stays fresh in fridge.

The first time of serving it was always fine, but when I would put the leftover tea in the fridge, it would get cloudy and icky tasting even in one day. The tea I make with this stays clear and fresh for days, a good thing since I'm the only one in my house who drinks it.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and designed, tho fancier than I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't need the inner tea basket because mostly I use family-sized Luzianne tea bags to make great iced tea. But when I made tea with those larger bags in the tea holder, it came out too weak--not enough room to "flow through" the bags. Fortunately the tea basket is removable. Next time I simply dropped the bags into the pitcher (without the tea basket) and the tea was perfect! The shape makes it easy to put in the fridge. I may try some of the exotic tea blends made by this company, in which case I'd use the tea basket. I may also try putting fresh mint in the tea basket once the tea is made.
customer_reviews.author: Di-zee

customer_reviews.title: Simple to Use - Great Results

customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: So Good I Think I'll Buy Another
customer_reviews.text: Works great and can make iced tea at the lake with a camp fire and some ice from the cooler. I drink tea instead of soda and use Stevia instead of sugar. I like strong tea so I let it set for quite a while then pour in five packets of Stevia and fill it nearly to the top with ice. I shake it back and forth until my hand on the bottom becomes cold and the ice is almost gone. I think I will get a second one as I go through this fairly fast especially during the summer months when I'm working outside.

All the leaves stay inside the infuser and I take it outside and put it in the garden. Much easier than washing out my tea kettle and straining the tea. Love this product and the boiling water doesn't hurt it. Yay.

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy Iced Tea Maker!
customer_reviews.text: After years of using the Mr. Coffee Iced Tea Maker, I decided to give this a try. I was tired of dealing with stained pitchers and the storage required with the Mr. Coffee machine. This iced tea maker is awesome! You can flash chill with ice once you've brewed with boiling water or you can allow the tea to chill naturally in the fridge. I personally prefer the flash chill method, but if you don't have enough ice on hand, the other method works just fine. I also like that you can use loose tea! A really great value for a quality product!

I bought the one quart because its good for me alone for about three days with all the ice I use. It is indeed airtight. And makes good tea. I have so many teas that I only wanted to make a quart at a time as to change up the flavors. If you like only regular tea I'd recommend the two quart for larger quantities at a time. I just found that flashing it didn't really do much and it didn't make it cold enough anyway. Its a great container though!
